displaytitle: Vue d’une rue des Faubourgs de Besançon (View of a Street of the Outskirts of Besançon)

titles.title: Vue d’une rue des Faubourgs de Besançon (View of a Street of the Outskirts of Besançon)

makers.displaydate: 1802–1828; born Arnold, Englad; died London, England
makers.displaymaker: Richard Parkes Bonington, 1802–1828; born Arnold, Englad; died London, England

texts.textentryhtml: A precocious British-born artist who worked in France, Bonnington was largely responsible for introducing English watercolor painting techniques to French artists through his meticulously fi nished, naturalistic drawings of the environs of Paris. In 1822 he began to work in the newly fashionable medium of lithography and was invited by the Baron Isidore Justin Séverin Taylor to contribute drawings to the monumental publication series Voyages pittoresques et romantiques dans l’ancienne France (Picturesque and Romantic Voyages in Ancient France). Published from 1820 to 1878 in twenty-four volumes organized by geographic region, Baron Taylor’s enterprise provided armchair travelers with romantic views and literary descriptions of French landscapes.
